data.title: s/laterr/later/
Easier local (dynamic) variables
data.body:
Right now if I want to declare "local" variable (variable that is valid only for current label) I have to use `renpy.dynamic` and then init my variable.
So the code basically looks like this:

``` renpy
label my_utility_function:
    $ renpy.dynamic('x')
    $ x = 42
    # ...
    return
```

If I want to have many local variables I can write

``` renpy
label my_utility_function:
    $ renpy.dynamic('x', 'y', 'z')
    $ x = 42
    $ y = 13
    $ z = x + y
    # ...
    return
```

That's mostly OK but probably it could be better. I don't rally like additional statement (with renpy.dynamic) and it's a bit easy to forget to update arguments of `dynamic` when new variable is added or removed.

Maybe it's possible to add some syntax sugar for the case?
I would prefer to mark a variable as "context dynamic" at the point of declaration.
One option to do that is to introduce new keyword or new syntax:

```
local x = 42
temp x = 42
dynamic x = 42
$$ x = 42
```

Another option is to introduce a naming convention when variables with special names handled diffidently. Like, "__" prefixed variable means "dynamic".
Example:

```
$ __x = 42
```

Probably this option is more difficult to implement and it may break some existing code but it does not introduce any new keywords.

data.title: renpy.music.play() 'if_changed' parameter ignores loop offset when queuing an additional loop
data.body:
Tested in Ren'Py 6.99.11. Here are instructions to reproduce:

Specify menu music with a loop parameter in options.rpy:
`define config.main_menu_music = "<loop 22.073>bgm/1.ogg"`

Then, in a script file:

```
label splashscreen:
    $ renpy.music.play(config.main_menu_music)
```

The music starts playing on splash and continues on the main menu, which is the desired effect. However, on the first loop, the music starts from the beginning of the track instead of the specified offset. Subsequent loops work fine. Returning to the main menu from in-game also works fine.

Setting `loop=True` and `if_changed=True` doesn't make a difference.

I can probably work around this by creating my own main_menu label, but I believe this looping issue is probably not intended behavior.

data.title: urllib and urllib2 behave differently
data.body:
In the previous stable release it worked fine. Forgive me if is just a temporary issue of nightly, I just thought to report it in case.
I was using this function to check my site:

```
init python:
    import hashlib
    import urllib
    import urllib2
    import webbrowser

    def http(url,va):
        values = {'v1' : va[0]}
        for i in range(len(va)-1):
            values["v"+str(2+i)] = va[i+1]
        data = urllib.urlencode(values)
        req = urllib2.Request(url, data)
        try:
            response = urllib2.urlopen(req)
            the_page = response.read()
            return the_page
        except:
            return "fail"
```

but now it doesn't work anymore (always returns fail). It's not a firewall issue since if I try previous version works fine. So I am wondering if something changed related to urllib/urllib2 ? thanks

data.title: Changing screen resolutions after a game has launched breaks mouse cursor tracking
data.body:
I ran into this issue when playing Ladykiller in a Bind.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch the game at a lower resolution.
2. Switch to windowed in the game.
3. Switch to a higher resolution in the OS.
4. Switch to fullscreen in the game.

After doing this, the in-game mouse cursor tracking becomes offset from the actual position of the mouse cursor. This becomes obvious when trying to click buttons.

This was originally reported as #94 a few years ago, but closed because of difficulty reproing it. I can repro this consistently in LiaB using the steps above. I didn't take a video, but the video @renpytom posted in that issue is exactly the issue I'm having here.

data.title: Fixed behave weirdly when fit_first is provided
data.body:
This issue appears in Ren'Py  6.99.11.*. It worked fine in previous release.

If fit_first is set to True in a Fixed, elements with align property behave weirdly; they always render way outside of where they should.

A screenshot of what happens: ![screenshot 295](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311129/19172445/894773f8-8c3f-11e6-8afc-cb99c156b65d.png)

```
image sample_fixed = Fixed(Solid("#000000", xysize=(200, 200)), Text("Align set to (0.5, 0.5)", color="#ffffff", xalign=0.5, yalign=0.5), fit_first=True) # This behaves weirdly
image sample_fixed_2 = Fixed(Solid("#000000", xysize=(200, 200)), Text("No align specified", color="#ffffff"), fit_first=True) # This renders as it should
```

Here's the file, in case you want to test it out: [script.txt](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/files/514882/script.txt)

data.title: Lint shows voice file as not loadable if file_prefix or file_suffix is used
data.body:
So I have tweaked the voice channel to make my life a bit easier.

```
renpy.music.register_channel("voice", mixer="voice", loop=False, file_prefix="voice/", file_suffix=".mp3")
```

But in this case, lint throws a warning:

```
game/file1.rpy:118 voice file 'ding/roger_07' is not loadable
```

The game runs fine though.

data.title: Fix cut off sentence in changelog
data.body:
In the changelog there was a sentence that ended abruptly:

> Ren'Py can be made to return to the old behavior (in which only translate language style, translate language python, and callbacks are executed) by setti

I changed it back to how it was before 4b06e96d28e30234251271cc405573981c684fd9, where it got cut off for some reason.

data.title: Weird showif behavior inside vbox/hbox
data.body:
I'm not sure if this would technically be considered a bug or not, but the behavior seems counter-intuitive, so I thought I'd bring it up.

``` renpy
screen test:

  vbox:
    xalign 0.5
    yalign 0.5
    spacing -3

    showif flag1:
      textbutton "Item 1" action Return()
    showif flag2:
      textbutton "Item 2" action Return()
    showif flag3:
      textbutton "Item 3" action Return()
    showif flag4:
      textbutton "Item 4" action Return()
    showif flag5:
      textbutton "Item 5" action Return()
    showif flag6:
      textbutton "Item 6" action Return()
    showif flag7:
      textbutton "Item 7" action Return()
    showif flag8:
      textbutton "Item 8" action Return()

default flag1 = True
default flag2 = True
default flag3 = True
default flag4 = True
default flag5 = True
default flag6 = True
default flag7 = True
default flag8 = True

label start:

  "Showing screen with all flags true."

  call screen test

  "Showing screen with flags 3-6 false."

  $ flag3 = False
  $ flag4 = False
  $ flag5 = False
  $ flag6 = False

  call screen test

  return
```

With the middle four items set to False, Item 7 overlaps Item 2 in the vbox. `showif` executes and subsequently hides items 3-6, so they have zero height but are still subject to the `spacing -3` property, causing the buttons to overlap.

Based on the documentation, I would expect the hidden items to either take up no space at all, ignoring the style property and displaying the same as if `if` were used instead of `showif`, or for them to take up the same amount of space as if they were visible, meaning 1, 2, 7, and 8 display in the same location in both instances.

The latter option seems more intuitive to me, personally (at least in my use case--a replay menu listing numbered scenes the user has previously seen).

data.title: suppress_overlay is True on return to game after Alt+F4
data.body: https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=32&t=40519

data.title: No configurable/usable keymap on Android TV
data.body:
Since Android TV devices frequently use remotes with only directional, selector and back buttons, the default keymap renders them unable to do basic things like access the menu.

I think ideally, in game the left/right buttons would be mapped to forward/back through text while the actual back button summoned the menu.

data.title: Problem with has inside use.
data.body: https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=40495

data.title: Movie() doesn't show on layer when Sound is mute.
data.body:
Ren'Py 6.99.12.1764

Movie doesn't display on the layer when Sound is mute in Preference menu. When increase the value of the sound in Preference menu, the Movie is then show up.

```
init:
    image movie layer = Movie(play="movies/movie_layer.webm")

label start:
    scene movie layer onlayer background
```

data.title: Replace deprecated md5 library with hashlib
Replace print statement with print function
data.body:
Used py2to3 to convert everything.
Skipped the scripts and sphinx directories, wasn't sure if changing them was required for ren'py.

In launcher/game there were some files where it wasn't immediately clear if any of the code in there was from a 3rd party. I had to modify them to get renpy.exe to run.

Took the opportunity to run autopep8 with the following rules on the effected files:

E26  - Fix spacing after comment hash for inline comments.
E301 - Add missing blank line.
E302 - Add missing 2 blank lines.
E303 - Remove extra blank lines.

A very quick test had renpy running with all the changes, but it certainly needs to be heavily tested. If there's some test cases for features that use print, that would help.

data.title: Using from __future__ import print_function universally
data.body:
"from **future** import print_function" is used in a few places, but mostly the print statement is used.

Porting ren'py to Python3 probably should happen sometime in the next 3 years. As a first step, I suggest dealing with the print statements.

data.title: Use built-in set instead of deprecated import
data.body:
In warp.py and python.py, sets.Set was being used. This is deprecated as of python 2.6. I replaced the usage with the built-in set and set comprehension.

There were 3 outright removals in RevertableSet(): The wrappers for **copy**, **deepcopy**, and union_update(), but I don't believe anything in ren'py hinges on that particular implementation. I'm mildly concerned about removing the copies, but none of the other Revertables use them.

The number of changes exploded a bit due to my IDE's linting. I only applied style changes that seemed inoffensive, but any can be reverted if they break overall style.

Tested the following scenarios:

1) On the command line, entered: renpy.exe "my_project" --warp "rpy_script":"line_number"
Result: Game opens at that line, effects occurring earlier are not applied, "return" statement at end of label returns player to the specified line number.

2) Created a set using both x = set([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 1, 1]) and x = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 1, 1}, then verified each contained no duplicates. Verified that both create RevertableSet, not set.

data.title: Raise zorder for confirm screen.
Building a "directory" package fails on Mac-related files
data.body:
When building a package declared with

```
build.package("dir", "directory", "windows mac linux renpy all", "Directory")
```

Ren'Py attempts to create the following files

```
<gamename>.app/Contents/Info.plist
<gamename>.app/Contents/MacOS/<gamename>
<gamename>.app/Contents/Resources/icon.icns
```

without creating the intermediate directories, causing an exception.

```
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "game/distribute.rpy", line 1185, in script
  File "game/distribute.rpy", line 1192, in <module>

  File "game/distribute.rpy", line 981, in make_package
  File "launcher/game/package_formats.rpy", line 230, in add_file
    shutil.copy2(path, fn)
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: u"X:\\Programming\\Ren'Py\\Projects\\testing-1.0-dists\\testing-1.0-dir\\testing.app/Contents/Info.plist"

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "game/distribute.rpy", line 1185, in script
```

data.title: Skip indicator / button behavior
data.body:
With the oldGui if I hit skip and reach the point to unseen text for example (where it should stop) the skip button goes "insensitive" but the skip indicator ist still there.

With the newGui the skip button shows still "selected" and also the skip indicator is still shown.

Tom how about changing the behavior to: as soon skip comes to stop making the button inactive and hide the skip indicator?

Here is a screenshot to compare:
![bildschirmfoto vom 2016-09-12 09 07 10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5165216/18427574/5fd05d5c-78c9-11e6-9e74-6589c1e489de.png)
